title: Stained-glass windows and flagstone flooring: the showstopping renovation of a 12th-century rectory
text:
An old property will, inevitably, bear the hallmarks of its occupants’ taste over the years. In the case of Isabel Howett’s family home in Lincolnshire, a former rectory built in the 12th century, those hallmarks include the stained glass windows installed for an order of Crowland monks in the 16th century; a two-storey extension added by a Victorian philanthropist vicar; and, more recently, an inventive restyle to suit the requirements of modern family life.
